runs.comm: good swing away from the batsman, who watchfully leaves it alone.
flips over to leg stump with a short of a length delivery, nudged away off his thighs

right down the throat of Malinga at third man! Myburgh busts tonight! This was fullish and angled across him as Kulasekara invited the drive. Myburgh doesn't seem like a man who says no thank you to those balls and flayed at it. Gets a very, very thick outside edge that carries all the way to the deep. Malinga looks back to check he hasn't trod on the ropes and then jogs up to celebrate
fullish on and around the stumps, defends
tight line from Kulasekara again, blocked down the pitch
ripper to finish off. This straightens off a length and leaves Swart poking outside his off stump. Terrific first over
back of a length outside off, dabbed towards point
movement for Mathews as well. And he manages a bit of extra bounce too. Back of a length and outside off, Barresi pushes from the crease and is beaten
outside edge wanders away to deep third man. Probing away outside off. That held on the pitch a little

dances down the pitch and he has whacked it, only this takes the top edge. Mathews has adjusted his length and dug in short. No room on offer either as this sails into the night sky but Sanga gets under it with those big gloves and snaps it up. This isn't the Netherlands that played the last game

and another one! This has been thumped straight to the hands of the captain at cover! Netherlands are digging themselves into a great big hole here. Back of a length outside off, he stands up tall and punches it right off the middle but has forgotten all about placement.
good length ball, shaping away from the batsman, who doesn't want to play at it. Pulls his bat well inside the line
fullish and just a shade outside off, Cooper shuffles across and blocks off the back foot
darts this in at him off a length, Cooper was a little late on the flick. They try and sneak a leg-bye and succeed because Kula has to turn and aim at bowler's end. Doesn't hit direct
big inswinger raps him on the front pad. Borren had planted it in line and has to bring his bat around it. Think that was doing too much
fullish, around off stump. Defended off the front foot
full and curling in at him, Borren's flick square on the leg side doesn't bear fruit
bit of width and he's carved it to cover off the front foot. Solid stroke
back of a length and outside off, steered with an open face to point
slower ball with a bit of width, Cooper leans forward and drives in front of point. Great timing
not quite short enough as he rocks back, but the pull goes off a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket
dug in short but this time Mathews is a bit too nippy for him. Gets a glove as he attempts another pull. Lobs over in the area of short fine leg, but drops short of Mendis
shortish and just outside the off stump, he leaps up off his feet and defends with soft hands

trapped in front by an inswinger! Borren bags the third duck of the innings. This is fullish and drew the batsman forward, but he had to play around the front pad having not taken into account Mathews' swing.
a bit slower to start off as he goes full and outside off. The batsman was deceived and by the time he adjusts with a dab, hes beaten
fullish and outside off, Cooper slashes and misses
135kph, a hint of away movement for Malinga as Cooper plays well away from his body. Can't connect this time either
134kph, just short of a good length and this time he gets into better position to steer to point
inswinging yorker homing in on off-stump but Ben keeps out. That's cricket's equivalent of a heat-seeking missle
another one full on leg stump, Ben goes for a whip but this scurries off the pad square on the leg side
fullish on off stump, comes forward and punches to cover
good length ball pushed across the left-hander, lures him into a push and beats him comfortably with a bit of nip away
and another one that's a bit too much for him. Inches forward and pushes on the up, but the ball having pitched on a good length curls away and bounces a bit more
whack, what an answer! this was length on leg stump and he's picked it away to the midwicket boundary. Top shot
dab to third man doesn't work as this back of a length ball outside off beats the ouside edge
far too close for that late cut and Mathews continues to generate good bounce off the deck. Can't connect and that ends the powerplay. Netherlands are 15 for 4
tentative push to long-on as this was a quick, flat legspinner outside off
this one moves away from the left-hander. Goes for a drive on the up and gets a thick outside edge that seems set for the third man boundary, but Kusal dives head-first and pulls it back
gorgeous! This was tossed up with a bit of width and Cooper just leaned into a cover drive that was supremely well timed
quick and flat again and he's on the stumps as Tom nudges into the leg side

dances down to reach the pitch and has slammed this to long-off. A dive prevents it from reaching the boundary, but they're looking to steal an extra run. Direct hit and Mendis did well to recognise it was on target and pulls his hands away from the line of the throw. Kula, you beauty. Take a bow
goes deep in his crease to block a length ball that skids onto him
extra bounce continuing to trouble them. Short of a length just outside off pushes him back in the crease as he dabs with soft hands
fullish and outside off, Cooper comes forward and drives. Gets an outside edge to third man
goes full and straight and forces Bukhari, the new batsman, to hurry into his defensive stroke
fullish and outside off, Bukhari strides forward in search of an on-the-up cover drive. Bit more bounce foils his stroke
good length ball outside off, Cooper shuffles on his back foot and punches through the covers
bit of bottom edge that scurries right between the keeper and slip. Quick and flat leg spinner and the batsman went right back in his crease and tried to flick to midwicket
moves across to off stump in search for the lap over fine leg. The swing doesn't connect and the ball thuds into his pads in front of leg stump. Appeal upheld, umpire's call on hitting leg
tossed up on off stump, lunges forward on off stump and sweeps to deep square leg
flighted on off and this is driven down the ground
well bowled there. Good length ball with a bit of spin away. Comes forward and can only defend
they're struggling to pick him big time! This leaps up off the pitch and jags in at him. Adjusts well enough as he defends with soft hands
full toss on off stump, pushed into the off side
slings one in nice and full on middle stump, whipped away to long leg

he ain't doin none o that. This is a slow yorker and he is thoroughly flummoxed by it. Into the flick too early, tries to slow the bat speed but doesn't get it low enough to prevent the ball from sneaking through and clattering into the stumps. Static feet helped too
another attempted slow yorker, but this ends up a full toss on leg stump. Worked away to deep square leg
full and targeting leg stump, nudged behind square leg

and another for the slow yorker! This one dipped massively as Bukhari looks for midwicket. Nowhere near this ball as it clips his pad and ricochets onto the stumps. Netherlands are on course for making the lowest total (previous 56) in T20 cricket.

caught at slip and Seelaar walks away with a bit of a smile. He knows Sri Lanka have been far too good for them. Slows this up and he gets good turn after pitching it full. He goes forward to block, and gets an outside edge that is pouched by slip who was diving low to his right
flighted outside leg stump and goes for a lead-footed flick. Gets a leading edge which is too far wide of the bowler

and it's been wrapped up in a nice little bow by a wrong 'un. Tossed up on off stump and this rips back in. Malik has no clue this was the variation and was setting himself up to hit it square. By the time he read it off the pitch, it was too late. This is the lowest T20I score in history
